history.content:
If you're in the College of Letters and Science, here's the link for that: http://ls-advise.berkeley.edu/registration/schedule.html#minimum

The section you should be looking at is this one:

Graduating Senior (minimum one course, or number of units required to graduate)Visit 206 Evans Hall to confirm degree candidacy and process request

So pretty much those classes that you'd be taking have to be the required classes needed in order to graduate. Once you confirm that, the people at the office in 206 Evans hall will allow you to take less than the minimum # of units with ease. They'll just look at your Cal ID, type something on the computer, and it'll be done in a second. You need to make sure that dropping down to 11 units will not affect your financial aid though!! If you do have fin aid, check with the Fin Aid office by visiting or calling them to make sure that you're good to drop down to that low of units.

So here's the link for that: http://ls-advise.berkeley.edu/registration/schedule.html#minimum

The section you should be looking at is this one:

Graduating Senior (minimum one course, or number of units required to graduate)Visit 206 Evans Hall to confirm degree candidacy and process request

So pretty much those classes that you'd be taking have to be the required classes needed in order to graduate. Once you confirm that, the people at the office in 206 Evans hall will allow you to take less than the minimum # of units with ease. They'll just look at your Cal ID, type something on the computer, and it'll be done in a second. You need to make sure that dropping down to 11 units will not affect your financial aid though!! If you do have fin aid, check with the Fin Aid office by visiting or calling them to make sure that you're good to drop down to that low of units.

So here's the link for that: http://ls-advise.berkeley.edu/registration/schedule.html#minimum

The section you should be looking at is this one:

Graduating Senior (minimum one course, or number of units required to graduate)Visit 206 Evans Hall to confirm degree candidacy and process request

So pretty much those classes that you'd be taking have to be the required classes needed in order to graduate. Once you confirm that, they'll allow you to take less than the minimum # of units with ease. They'll just look at your Cal ID and it'll be done in a second. You need to make sure that dropping down to 11 units will not affect your financial aid though!! If you do have fin aid, check with the Fin Aid office by visiting or calling them to make sure that you're good to drop down to that low of units.

Or, if you're in COE: http://engineering.berkeley.edu/academics/undergraduate-guide/degree-requirements-and-major-information

  • Enforcement of the minimum 12 units and 2 technical courses per term requirement will continue until the last semester of completing the degree, during which the student may take less than the minimum units. In the final semester students are free to take fewer than 12 units. (Students receiving Federal Financial Aid may be required to enroll in 12 units; students should consult with the Financial Aid office to determine if enrolling in fewer than 12 units will impact their aid package.) If a student completes his/her major requirements earlier than their final semester, they may petition to take fewer than 2 technical courses but must continue to meet the minimum 12 unit per term requirement until their final semester.

---

If you are a COE student in your final semester and do not need to take 12 units, you will want to contact your ESS Advisor so that we can adjust your minimum units in the system. You would still be paying a full-time tuition fee. You may also want to talk to your ESS advisor about options if you have completed all of your requirements and want to take classes on a pass/no pass basis.

Financial aid recipients - You should check in with the financial aid office to see what the impact would be on not being considered a full-time student.

International students - Please go to the Berkeley International Office and ask them for the petition to take less than 12 units and then take it to ESS (230 Bechtel) to have your ESS advisor sign it.  Both your ESS advisor and one of the Berkeley International Office advisors will need to sign off their approvals on that sheet.

Or, if you're in COE: http://engineering.berkeley.edu/academics/undergraduate-guide/degree-requirements-and-major-information

  • Enforcement of the minimum 12 units and 2 technical courses per term requirement will continue until the last semester of completing the degree, during which the student may take less than the minimum units. In the final semester students are free to take fewer than 12 units. (Students receiving Federal Financial Aid may be required to enroll in 12 units; students should consult with the Financial Aid office to determine if enrolling in fewer than 12 units will impact their aid package.) If a student completes his/her major requirements earlier than their final semester, they may petition to take fewer than 2 technical courses but must continue to meet the minimum 12 unit per term requirement until their final semester.

children.subject:
Oh my gosh! I completely forgot I could do this! 

You just made my day! :D

#IPromiseItsNotSenioritis

history.content: Apologies if this is the wrong place for this question. This is my final semester and I plan on taking 11 units, which is below the minimum unit requirement. What is the procedure for filling out a petition? Thanks!
history.subject: Taking less than 12 units
